httpserver

Class HTTPRequest

  • java.lang.Object
    • httpserver.HTTPRequest
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class HTTPRequest
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    An HTTPRequest takes an incoming connection and parses out all of the relevant data, supposing the connection follows HTTP protocol. At present, HTTPRequest only knows how to handle HTTP 1.1 requests, and doesn't handle persistent connections. Technically, it could handle an HTTP 1.0 request, because 1.0 doesn't have persistent connections.
    See Also:
    HTTP 1.1 Spec, HTTPHandler

    • Constructor Detail

      • HTTPRequest

        public HTTPRequest(java.net.Socket connection)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   java.net.SocketException,
                   HTTPException
        Used to parse out an HTTP request provided a Socket and figure out the handler to be used.
        Parameters:
        connection - The socket between the server and client
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When it gets thrown by parseRequest().
        java.net.SocketException - When it gets thrown by parseRequest().
        HTTPException - When something that doesn't follow HTTP spec occurs.
        See Also:
        parseRequest()

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • parseRequest

        public void parseRequest()
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         java.net.SocketException,
                         HTTPException
        Kicks off the request's parsing. Called inside constructor.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - When an InputStream can't be retreived from the socket.
        java.net.SocketException - When the client breaks early. This is a browser issue, and not a server issue, but it gets thrown upstream because it can't be dealt with until it gets to the HTTPServer.
        HTTPException - When headers aren't in key/value pairs separated by ": ".
        See Also:
        HTTPServer

      • determineHandler

        public HTTPHandler determineHandler()
                             throws HTTPException
        Figure out what kind of HTTPHandler you want, based on the path.

        This uses the statically set HTTPRouter to determine the correct HTTPHandler to be used for the current request. If there isn't a statically set HTTPRouter, a 500 error is sent back to the client.

        Returns:
        a new instance of some form of HTTPHandler.
        Throws:
        HTTPException
        See Also:
        HTTPRouter, HTTPRouter#determineHandler, HTTPHandler

      • isType

        public boolean isType(java.lang.String requestTypeCheck)
        Return if the request type is the passed in type.
        Parameters:
        requestTypeCheck - The type to check.
        Returns:
        whether the request type equals the passed in String.

      • setRequestLine

        public void setRequestLine(java.lang.String line)
                    throws HTTPException
        Sets the requestLine, and all derived items.

        Based off of the passed in line, the request type, request path, and request protocol can be set.

        Parameters:
        line - The first line in an HTTP request. Should be in [type] [full path] [protocol] form.
        Throws:
        HTTPException - When the first line does not contain two spaces, signifying that the passed in line is not in HTTP 1.1. When the type is not an expected type (currently GET, POST, and HEAD).
        See Also:
        setRequestType(java.lang.String), setFullPath(java.lang.String), setRequestProtocol(java.lang.String)

      • getRequestLine

        public java.lang.String getRequestLine()
        Return the request line.
        Returns:
        the request line.

      • setFullPath

        public void setFullPath(java.lang.String inPath)
        Set the full path, and path list.

        Because the path list is derived from the full path, it's set at the same time.

        Parameters:
        inPath - The full requested path (in `/path/to/request` form)
        See Also:
        setPath(java.lang.String), setSplitPath(java.lang.String)

      • getFullPath

      • getPath

        public java.lang.String getPath()
        Gets the path relative to the handler's path.
        Returns:
        Everything in the path after the handler's path.

      • setSplitPath

        public void setSplitPath(java.lang.String fullPath)
        Given a full path, set the splitPath to the path, split by `/`.

        If there's a query string attached to the path, it gets removed from the splitPath, and the request's associated GET data is parsed from the query string.

        See Also:
        getGetData()

      • setSplitPath

        public void setSplitPath(java.util.List<java.lang.String> path)

        Returns:
        A List of Strings
